channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street lamp bulb is twitching, 21st November
item.description:
The bulb is going or has now gone. My wife is nervous about walking home as it now very dark opposite the alley behind our flat. This has been flickering for the last few days, but has now started going off and on again periodically
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Tudor Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous flashing lighting on dark walkway, 21st November
item.description:
The lighting on this pathway only flashes on via motion sensor. The light is very bright and goes out straightaway, rendering the path users unable to see anything at all. It made me nauseous and unsure of my footing. People will get hurt because of this and it is appalling it hasn't been fixed yet in the several months since it was installed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, King Stairs Close, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop 18958 chislehurst rd, 21st November
item.description:
BUS stop for 61 Bus South bound number 18958 CALLED WILLET WAY BUS STOP had been badly damaged Face plate removed put behind telegraph post (See picture)What's left of face plate covered in graffiti .The damage is now 6 months old .NEW FACE PLATE COVERING NEW TIMETABLE URGENTLY REQUIRED .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Thames Water works, 21st November
item.description:
There are Thames Water works at this location. There are vehicle movement restrictions. These are being ignored which is causing dangerous situations to all road users. Vehicles are ignoring the restrictions, driving though coned off areas which is endangering all road users. This needs to be enforced or there will be a serious accident at this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Common, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 21st November
item.description:
Residents at number 4 keep dumping their old rubbish on the pavement. Clearly no one wants their broken old kids toys but every week they are leaving their junk out that no one ever takes. Last week it was bed frame that had to be removed after it blocked up the whole pavement. Photo attached.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Parish Gate Drive, Sidcup
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards at entrance to Halliwick Rec left down AGAIN, 21st November
item.description:
The workmen working in Halliwick Recreation Ground have left the bollards at the entrance to the park down again, when leaving the park today. This is leaving the park wide open to travellers, which we have had plenty of trouble with whenever the park is left open before. We have pulled one of the bollards up (although it's not up properly and will easily fall down but at least it looks up for now until someone knocks it); the other bollard appears to be locked in the down position and a vehicle can still fit past so we've pulled the gates round to make it look like it might be closed if someone was looking from the top of the road as they pass. Please can these bollards be left UP!! This park has only just been revamped and the playground is still being done up. We don't need it being wrecked!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Avenue, Colney Hatch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Fox on Street - dangerous as cars are swerving to avoid, 21st November

item.title: Street light over bridge not working, 21st November
item.description:
The tall bright street lamp illuminating the Ivy Bridge and the attached bridge weight limit sign are both not working. Lamp column situated at start of foot bridge on Murray Avenue side. It has been out for several days now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London

item.title: Strong smell of urine in the Christmas market huts opposite macdonald, 21st November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Leicester Square, Mayfair, City of Westminster
